Windu had seen plenty of Jedi like Anakin fall to the Dark side, and Palaptine had a lot of influence over the boy. Still he had Qui-Gon. "Whatever you do, keep an eye on the boy. And if necessary-"

"I know. But I have faith in Anakin, I believe when the time comes he will do the right thing."
1221211212122112112221111221211121.title: No servant can serve two masters

1221211212122112112221111222.content:
"You did well today, Obi-Wan," Mace Windu commended. He looked across the circle of chairs to Qui-Gon. "Perhaps we were wrong about not training Anakin." Qui-Gon didn't have to force the smile that settled on his lips as Obi-Wan bowed and accepted the words of honor.
"I can't take all the credit, Master. Anakin fought Dooku alone for most of the battle. As I understand it, he made a difficult choice in sparing him..." A hard look settled into Mace Windu's features.
"Yes... From what you've told us, the exchange between the Chancellor and Anakin is... disturbing, to put it mildly."
"This does not seem like the Chancellor at all," Qui-Gon mused, "Are you certain Anakin wasn't embellishing?" Qui-Gon's eyes unfocused momentarily, as if recalling a distant memory.
"I'm certain, Master. Anakin had no reason to make this up, and I sensed no dishonesty from him."
"If this exchange is not an isolated incident, we may have a serious problem on our hands," Windu observed. "We cannot allow the leader of the Republic to become a destructive influence on young Skywalker." Yoda glanced at Mace.
"To a dark place this line of thought will carry us. Great care we must take."
"Agreed," Qui-Gon said, "I will talk with Anakin when he returns. For now, we have other matters to discuss."
1221211212122112112221111222.title: To A Dark Place....

12212112121221121122211112221.content:
A speeder buzzed past the apartment window as Padmé Amidala glanced out to the Coruscant cityscape. A brief chime indicated an arrival and as she turned, she saw Anakin standing in the doorway, grinning from ear to ear.
"Ani, you're home!!" She rushed over and threw her arms around him as he pulled her close.
"I've missed you, Padmé. If the Chancellor hadn't been kidnapped, I don't think they'd have ever brought us back from the Outer Rim sieges." She looked up at him, a mix of emotions clouding her chestnut eyes. "You're shaking, what's wrong?"
"I... Nothing's wrong. Ani, I... Have good news. I... We're pregnant." Anakin stood, stunned for a moment.
"That's... That's great news." Consequences were multiplying in his head by the nanosecond. The Council would expel him. The Senate would kick Padmé out. What would Master Jinn think? And most worrisome was the realization that Anakin wasn't ready to be a father. None of this showed through in his smile though.
"Anakin, what if we're not ready for this? What if we... If I can't do it?"
"We'll be alright, Padmé. This baby will be a blessing, not a curse, I promise you."
"I hope you're right, General Skywalker."
"I know I'm right, Mrs. Skywalker. I love you."
"I love you too." As their lips touched, Anakin's communicator went off. He sighed as he answered it.
"General Skywalker."
"Anakin, we need to discuss some things, if you can spare a moment."
"Of course, Master Qui-Gon. I'll meet you in the Council chamber."
"I'll be waiting." Anakin shut the communicator off and kissed his wife once more.
"Wait for me, I'll be back." He strode from the apartment, leaving Padmé to wonder about what was going on.
12212112121221121122211112221.title: A Blessing, Not a Curse

122121121212211211222111122211.content:
"Anakin, what did Chancellor Palpatine tell you aboard Grievous' ship?" The younger Jedi glanced down, the internal struggle keeping him silent for a moment.
"He... He demanded that I kill Dooku. At the time, I thought little of it. The priority was to rescue the Chancellor and escape. After thinking about it, I don't understand. The Chancellor has never advocated this sort of violence before, Master." Qui-Gon remained quiet a moment, gathering his thoughts and taking in his former padawan's words.
"Anakin, I'm going to share something with you that the Council doesn't even know. I believe the Sith have control of the Senate."
"What?! But the Council decided that was impossible, didn't they?" Qui-Gon nodded.
"They did. They also weren't held captive by Dooku. I knew him better than anyone when he was my Master. There was no deceit in his voice when he told me this disturbing news, Anakin. This, combined with what you've said about the Chancellor's words... I believe Palpatine may be the Sith we've been on guard for."
"Master, what are you saying?! The Chancellor has been nothing but supportive of the Jedi ever since he was elected, how can you accuse him of something like this?!"
"Anakin, quiet your mind and meditate on this. I want you to come to your own conclusion on this."
"I... Yes, Master..." Anakin stood and bowed, leaving the Council Chambers and heading back to Padme's apartment.
122121121212211211222111122211.title: A Dark Place...

I. Must stay with Star Wars. No venturing off into whatever other stories you want.

II. Try to stay with already established Star Wars characters. New characters are fine, but not encouraged.

III. No inappropriate material. Different time, different story.
